body_html: No. If the backprop needs a forward tensor, it needs its values for all iterations. This is very similar to a very deep network where each iteration can be viewed as a layer. Of course, this can be optimized by for example recomputing the values as opposed to keeping them in memory.
body_text: No. If the backprop needs a forward tensor, it needs its values for all iterations. This is very similar to a very deep network where each iteration can be viewed as a layer. Of course, this can be optimized by for example recomputing the values as opposed to keeping them in memory.
body: No. If the backprop needs a forward tensor, it needs its values for all iterations. This is very similar to a very deep network where each iteration can be viewed as a layer. Of course, this can be optimized by for example recomputing the values as opposed to keeping them in memory.
